action.action-desc: Mr. Bacon (for himself, Mr. Van Drew, Ms. Matsui, and Ms. Scanlon) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide authorization for nonpecuniary damages in an action resulting from a cruise ship voyage occurring on the high seas.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Hammers' Law.

subsection.text: Section 30307 of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the section heading, by striking Commercial aviation accidents and inserting Limitations in certain cases;
by striking subsection (a) and inserting the following:
The term cruise ship means a passenger vessel, other than a vessel of the United States operated by the Federal Government or a vessel owned and operated by a State, that—

subparagraph.text: is authorized to carry at least 250 passengers;
has onboard sleeping facilities for each passenger;
is on a voyage that embarks or disembarks passengers in the United States; and
is not engaged on a coastwise voyage.

paragraph.text: The term nonpecuniary damages means damages for loss of care, comfort, and companionship.
in subsection (b), by inserting or cruise ship voyage after commercial aviation; and
in subsection (c), by inserting or cruise ship voyage after commercial aviation.
